content: The **Second Lee Kuan Yew Cabinet** was the [Cabinet of Singapore](/wiki/Cabinet_of_Singapore) from 19 October 1963 to 15 April 1968. The cabinet was formed by [Prime Minister](/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Singapore) [Lee Kuan Yew](/wiki/Lee_Kuan_Yew) after the [People's Action Party](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party) won a supermajority of the seats in the [Parliament of Singapore](/wiki/Parliament_of_Singapore) in the [1963 general election](/wiki/1963_Singaporean_general_election). It is the cabinet that governed Singapore when it was a [state in Malaysia](/wiki/Singapore_in_Malaysia). It is also Singapore's first cabinet following its independence on 9 August 1965. The cabinet was succeeded by the [Third Lee Kuan Yew Cabinet](/wiki/Third_Lee_Kuan_Yew_Cabinet). ## Cabinet The Second Lee Kuan Yew Cabinet consisted of the following members.
